intro: Hieracium aspericaule, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are rough and hairy, giving it a distinctive texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium aspericaule is often considered a weed but can be found in various habitats across temperate regions.
